result.execSummary:
The defendant Kameron J Simpson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess w/Intent-THC (<=200 grams) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(h)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Imposed and Stayed. Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 4 years bifurcated sentence.
Consecutive to: count 1 & count 4 in 14CF1754

Conditions, if revoked, are as outlined in probation conditions.
Consecutive to: count 1 & count 4 in 14CF1754

miscConds.notes: Waive court costs. Defendant must submit a DNA sample as required by law and must pay mandatory DNA surcharge.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment OR attend school full-time, may be a combination of both to equal 40 hours per week.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.
No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.

Comply with treatment program from mental health assessment including taking medications as prescribed. Participate in the Fatherhood Program at the YMCA. Comply with family court order. Do not drive unless properly licensed. Counseling that is directed towards domestic violence. Firearm warning given. Voting prohibited until sentence is complete and civil rights have been restored. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant Kameron J Simpson in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Antoinette L. Rich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue
St- In 15CF1471 Plea to count 3; DRI count 1 & count 2. In 16CF24 plea to count 1 w/o repeater; DRI count 2 & count 3. In 16CF60 Dismiss outright. 
Rights Given
P- NC
BTC: Finding of guilt on count 3; DRI count 1 & count 2 in 15CF1471 & count 1; DRI count 2 & count 3 in 16CF24. 16CF60 is dismissed outright.

14CF1363
Count 1- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 3 Years probation, to run consecutive to jail sentence, provide DNA sample + pay surcharge, waive court costs 

14CF1754
Count 1- 3 months RCJ, $100 domestic violence surcharge to be paid in 60 days, waive costs on count 3 & 4
Count 3- 4 Years WPS, 2 Years init, 2 Years es, i/s, 3 years probation, concurrent with 14CF1363
Count 4- 3 months RCJ, to run consecutive to count 1, credit for time served

15CF1471
Count 3- Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, waive court costs

16CF24
Count 1- Withheld sentence, 3 years probation, waive court costs

Conditions:
9 months RCJ - stayed in 15CF1471 & 16CF24
Comply with treatment program from mental health assessment - taking med's as prescribed 
No drugs, no alcohol
Participate in the Father Hood Program at YMCA
Maintain employment, school or combination of both
Comply with family court order
Counseling that is directed towards domestic violence
Do not drive unless valid license

Defendant Kameron J Simpson in court with attorney Margaret Marie Johnson.  Defendant Kameron J Simpson in custody.  Matthew J. Hastings appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Darlene Shue.  2 new cases have been filed since last hearing.  Defense requests a reducted bond to $250C on each case.  Letter from victim has been filed with the court.  Treatment and visitation are top priorities for the defendant and regarding bond modifications.  State believes bond as set is appropriate.  Judge asks questions of defendants mother.  Establishing paternity has begun in November but no case has been filed yet.  
14CF1754 - $500C plus $3000SB - release tohouse arrest at 1133 Marquette St.  GPS monitoring.  exceptions for ZCI monitoring, court appearance, meetings with attorney and treatment program attendance.  Defendant may only leave the house in the presence of his mother.  No contact with AM.  A family court order regarding the child is needed.  Compliant with any conditions of treatment program he enters into.  No alco or controlled substances.  Absolute sobriety.  ZCI to monitor.  Defendant may attend AA Meetings and proof must be filed.
14CF1630 - $3000SB same conditions.  No requirement of no contact on this case.  No family court order needed on this case.

Preliminary hearing on October 15, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any controlled substances.  This is to be monitored by random UA's and/or breathalyzers.  The defendant is to report directly to Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI) for monitoring - report to 524 Main Street, Suite 302, Racine, WI  53403 (third floor of the Monument Square Building) or call (262)632-1780 to immediately schedule an appointment.   The defendant is further ordered to report for testing after each court appearance.  Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
